citations.narrative:
The facility failed to maintain the reindeer enclosure’s primary fence in good repair. A gap in the chain-link fence leaves
the animals vulnerable to injury. On the south side of the reindeer enclosure, the chain links have been bent upwards
leaving an arc-shaped gap approximately one foot high at its center and approximately two to three feet long. At least two
sharp edges are visible. The enclosure currently houses one male reindeer. It is possible that the reindeer could be
injured from the sharp metal points or from having antlers or other body parts get caught.
Enclosures with cracks, holes, or sharp edges can lead to animal entrapment and injury. Ensure that all housing facilities
are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection or by February 14, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity cannot continue under your existing USDA license as it has expired.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility failed to maintain the reindeer enclosure’s primary fence in good repair. A gap in the chain-link fence leaves 
the animals vulnerable to injury. On the south side of the reindeer enclosure, the chain links have been bent upwards 
leaving an arc-shaped gap approximately one foot high at its center and approximately two to three feet long. At least two 
sharp edges are visible. The enclosure currently houses one male reindeer. It is possible that the reindeer could be 
injured from the sharp metal points or from having antlers or other body parts get caught.  
 
Enclosures with cracks, holes, or sharp edges can lead to animal entrapment and injury. Ensure that all housing facilities 
are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection or by February 14, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity cannot continue under your existing USDA license as it has expired. 
 
 n
